## Welcome to my Engineering Class Projects page!

During the semester, I engjoy working on hands-on projects to develop new
and useful skills to broaden my problem solving toolbox. I believe projects and experiments are 
the best way to learn for yourself what works and what doesn't, and adjust as needed to keep
moving foward. My projects bring me great satisfaction and I love putting in the time and effort
to bringing my ideas to life. If they work, wonderful! And if they don't turn out as expected, 
I take what I learn and quickly and efficiently tweak my methods until I reach my desired outcome. 
Check out some of the projects I've worked on at Mudd so far!

<img src="images/fNIRS/headcap_cover.png" alt="fNIRS" style="width:100%; border-radius: 15px;">

  <div style="flex: 2; min-width: 300px;">
<p> 
  Dr. Burns at Pomona College uses functional Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (fNIRS) to monitor brain 
  activity by measuring how infrared light (IR) interacts with oxygenated hemoglobin (HbO) in the brain. 
  A significant challenge arises when using fNIRS with individuals who have thick or darker hair, 
  as the hair can block the IR light from properly reaching the scalp. With my team—Annette Chang, 
  [Brock Bownds](https://www.linkedin.com/in/brockbownds/), and [Gabrielle Reynolds](https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabbyreynolds/), we 
  sought to develop methods to effectively direct IR light from fNIRS devices to the scalp.
</p>
</div>
</div>
</p>
<p>

<div>
<button id="toggleButtona" onclick="toggleContenta()">Show More</button>
<div id="moreContenta" style="display:none;">
<div class="row">
<div class="column">
<p> ### What? ###
</p>
<p> 

<img src="images/fNIRS/design_solutions.png" alt="fNIRS" style="width:100%; border-radius: 15px;">

<div style="padding: 5px;">
</div>

- Developed and selected three design alternatives:

1. __Fiber Optic Attachment__ with __Custom Spring Cap__ threads IR light through thick hair to the scalp. 

2. __Hair Moving Pick__ moves hair away from covering the scalp.

3. __Wider Mounting Base__ enables more pressure between the scalp and optodes. 

</p>
</div>
<div class="column">
<p> ### How? ###
</p>
<p> 

<img src="images/fNIRS/optodes.png" alt="fNIRS" style="width:100%; border-radius: 15px;">

<div style="padding: 5px;">
</div>

- __Machined__ prototypes to verify proof of concept and refined iterations based on client input and 
professor feedback. 

- Developed comprehen- sive __process routers__ for all prototype designs and documented findings into 
reports to be shared with the team and the client. 

- Fostered a welcoming and collaborative environment for all team members. 

</p>
</div>
<div class="column">
<p> ### Results ###
</p>
<p> 

<img src="images/fNIRS/fNIRS_results.png" alt="fNIRS" style="width:100%; border-radius: 15px;">

<div style="padding: 5px;">
</div>

- Improved signal clarity of fNIR device for users with dense hair types (3C, 4A), improving readings from critical to acceptable. 

- Gained experience arranging and executing client meetings to determine project __objectives__, 
__constraint__, __functions__, and __means__. 

- Applied principles of __engineering design__ and __team dynamics__ to a real-world project.

</p>
